value.title: Intel is teaching a computer chip to smell
value.excerpt: Loihi, Intel's first neuromorphic computing chip, was unveiled in 2017 and pitched by the company as the next generation of AI, capable of applying the principles of computation found in biological brains to computer architectures. Loihi is capable of self-learning thanks to a new type of neural network dubbed "spiking neural network".

value.title: Intel made experimental chips that can smell
value.excerpt: but a team at Intel has been attempting to train AI to something unorthorodox for a computer: smell.
